lines.content: * The Main class serves as the entry point for the Osiris chat application.
* It initializes an instance of the Osiris chat-bot and starts the chat session.
* The Osiris class represents the main chatbot application.
* It manages user interactions, interprets commands, and handles task management.
private final TaskManager taskManager = new TaskManager();
private final Ui userInterface = new Ui();
* Initiates the chat session with the user.
* Manages user input, interprets commands, and handles task management.
* Abstract class representing a command to be executed.
* Checks if the command is to terminate the chat.
* @return true if the command is to terminate the chat, false otherwise.
* @return true if the command is executed successfully, false otherwise.
public abstract boolean execute(TaskManager taskManager, Ui userInterface);
* Represents a command to find tasks based on a search string.
* Constructs a FindTasksCommand object with the specified search string.
* @param searchString The search string to find relevant tasks.
* Executes the find tasks command, searching for relevant tasks based on the search string.
* @param taskManager   The TaskManager instance managing the tasks.
* @param userInterface The Ui instance for interacting with the user.
* @return True if the command execution is successful, false otherwise.
public boolean execute(TaskManager taskManager, Ui userInterface) {
* Command class representing a no-operation command.
* This command does nothing when executed.
public boolean execute(TaskManager taskManager, Ui userInterface) {
* Command class representing an unsupported command.
* Executes the unsupported command by displaying a message through the user interface.
public boolean execute(TaskManager taskManager, Ui userInterface) {
* Command class representing the addition of a deadline task.
* Constructs an AddDeadlineTaskCommand object with the specified task name and deadline.

* @param deadline The deadline of the task.
* Executes the command to add a deadline task.

public boolean execute(TaskManager taskManager, Ui userInterface) {
* Command class representing the addition of an event task.

* @param endDateTime   The end date and time of the event.
public addEventTaskCommand(String taskName, LocalDateTime startDateTime, LocalDateTime endDateTime) {
* Executes the command to add an event task.
* @return true if the command is executed successfully, false otherwise.
public boolean execute(TaskManager taskManager, Ui userInterface) {
boolean isSuccess = taskManager.addEventTask(this.taskName, this.startDateTime, this.endDateTime, false);
* Command class representing the addition of a to-do task.

public boolean execute(TaskManager taskManager, Ui userInterface) {

public boolean execute(TaskManager taskManager, Ui userInterface) {

* Constructs a RemoveTaskCommand with the specified task index.

public boolean execute(TaskManager taskManager, Ui userInterface) {

public boolean execute(TaskManager taskManager, Ui userInterface) {
* A singleton class for date and time formatters used in the application.

System.out.println("Failed to parse the date-time string: " + dateStr);
System.out.println("Please try /by dd-mm-yyyy for a deadline tasks.");
* Formats the user input string to a LocalDateTime object.

System.out.println("Failed to parse the date-time string: " + dateTimeStr);
System.out.println("Please provide date time range 'dd-MM-yyyy HHmm' format.");

public LocalDateTime[] userInputDateTimeRangeFormatter(String fromDateTimeStr, String toTimeStr) {

System.out.println("Please provide date time range in 'dd-MM-yyyy HHmm' format.");

DateTimeFormatter endDateTimeFormatter = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM d yyyy h:mm a");
System.out.println("Failed to parse the date time range: " + fromDateTimeStr + " OR " + toTimeStr);
* Interprets user input and returns the appropriate command.

* Manages file storage for the Osiris.
* Constructs a Storage object with the specified file path.
* @param filepath The file path for storage.
* Checks if the storage file exists.
* @return True if the storage file exists, false otherwise.
System.err.println("An error occurred with Function storageFileExist().");
* Manages storage in a text file format.
* Constructs a TxtFileStorage object with the specified file path.
* @param filepath The file path for the text file storage.
System.out.println("Failed to create Task Storage file: " + this.getFilepath());
System.out.println("Error: Unable to create new Txt file for Task storage.");
* Reads the contents of the text file storage.
* @return The contents of the text file storage as an ArrayList of strings.
System.out.println("Error: Unable to locate filepath " + this.getFilepath());
* Appends content to the text file storage.
* @param content The content to append to the text file storage.
System.out.println("Error: Unable to update Task Storage File. Trouble appending.");
* Clears the contents of the text file storage.
System.out.println("Error: Unable to update Task Storage File. Trouble clearing contents.");

* The DeadlineTask class represents a task with a deadline.
* Constructs a DeadlineTask object with the given task name and deadline.
* @param taskName The name of the task.
* @param deadline The deadline of the task.
* Constructs a DeadlineTask object with the given task name, completion status, and deadline.
* @param taskName    The name of the task.
* @param isCompleted The completion status of the task.
* @param deadline    The deadline of the task.
public DeadlineTask(String taskName, boolean isCompleted, LocalDate deadline) {
* Retrieves the deadline of the task as a string.
* @return The deadline of the task formatted as "MMM d yyyy".
* Retrieves the string representation of the DeadlineTask for storage purposes.
* @return The string representation of the DeadlineTask.
* Retrieves the string representation of the DeadlineTask for display purposes.
* @return The string representation of the DeadlineTask.
* The EventTask class represents a task that occurs within a specific time frame.
* Constructs an EventTask object with the given task name, start date/time, and end date/time.
* @param taskName      The name of the task.
* @param startDateTime The start date and time of the task.
* @param endDateTime   The end date and time of the task.
public EventTask(String taskName, LocalDateTime startDateTime, LocalDateTime endDateTime) {
* Constructs an EventTask object with the given task name, completion status, start date/time, and end date/time.
* @param taskName      The name of the task.
* @param isCompleted   The completion status of the task.
* @param startDateTime The start date and time of the task.
* @param endDateTime   The end date and time of the task.
public EventTask(String taskName, boolean isCompleted, LocalDateTime startDateTime, LocalDateTime endDateTime) {
* Retrieves the string representation of the start date and time of the task.
* @return The start date and time of the task formatted as "MMM d yyyy h:mm a".
* Retrieves the string representation of the end date and time of the task.
* @return The end date and time of the task formatted as "MMM d yyyy h:mm a".
* Retrieves the string representation of the EventTask for storage purposes.
* @return The string representation of the EventTask.
* Retrieves the string representation of the EventTask for display purposes.
* @return The string representation of the EventTask.
* The InvalidTaskException class represents an exception that is thrown when an invalid task name is assigned.
* Retrieves the string representation of the exception.
* @return The string representation of the exception.
* Retrieves the message associated with the exception.
* @return The message associated with the exception.
* The Task class represents a generic task in the Osiris application.
* It serves as the base class for different types of tasks.
* Constructs a Task object with the given task name.
* @param taskName The name of the task.
* Constructs a Task object with the given task name and completion status.
* @param taskName    The name of the task.
* @param isCompleted The completion status of the task.
* Retrieves the string representation of the task for storage purposes.
* @return The string representation of the task.
* Retrieves the string representation of the task for display purposes.
* @return The string representation of the task.
* The TaskManager class manages user tasks.
private final ArrayList<Task> userTasks = new ArrayList<>();
private final TxtFileStorage taskStorage = new TxtFileStorage(TASKSTORAGEFILEPATH);

* @param isCompleted The completion status of the task.

public boolean addToDoTask(String taskName, boolean isCompleted) {
* Adds a deadline task to the task manager.

* @param deadline    The deadline of the task.
* @param isCompleted The completion status of the task.
* @return True if the task is added successfully, false otherwise.
public boolean addDeadlineTask(String taskName, LocalDate deadline, boolean isCompleted) {
DeadlineTask newTask = new DeadlineTask(taskName, isCompleted, deadline);
* Adds an event task to the task manager.

* @param startDateTime The start date and time of the event.

* @param isCompleted   The completion status of the task.
* @return True if the task is added successfully, false otherwise.
public boolean addEventTask(String taskName, LocalDateTime startDateTime,
EventTask newTask = new EventTask(taskName, isCompleted, startDateTime, endDateTime);
* Retrieves a task from the task manager based on its index.
* @param index The index of the task.
* @return The task at the specified index.
* Retrieves all user tasks managed by the task manager.
* Removes a task from the task manager based on its index.
* @param index The index of the task to be removed.
* @return The removed task, or null if the index is out of bounds.
System.out.println("No task with index " + (index + 1) + ". Enter 'list' to view tasks.");
* Retrieves the total number of tasks managed by the task manager.

* @return True if the task is marked as completed successfully, false otherwise.
System.out.println("No task with index " + (index + 1) + ". Enter 'list' to view tasks.");
* Marks a task as incomplete based on its index.

System.out.println("Invalid day, month, or year in deadline. Please use dd-MM-yyyy. ");
